block.p: The Timex Corporation in Middlebury, Conn., has awarded its account to Kirshenbaum Bond & Partners in New York, part of the Kirshenbaum Bond Creative Network. Billings were estimated at $6 million to $10 million.

The decision came after a two-month review that had been narrowed to Kirshenbaum Bond and two others: Modernista in Boston, and the New York office of Bartle Bogle Hegarty, which is 49 percent owned by the Publicis Groupe..

The Timex Corporation in Middlebury, Conn., has awarded its account to Kirshenbaum Bond & Partners in New York, part of the Kirshenbaum Bond Creative Network. Billings were estimated at $6 million to $10 million.

The decision came after a two-month review that had been narrowed to Kirshenbaum Bond and two others: Modernista in Boston, and the New York office of Bartle Bogle Hegarty, which is 49 percent owned by the Publicis Groupe..
The review, which was managed by Pile & Company in Boston, began when Timex unexpectedly parted ways with its agency of 16 years, the Minneapolis office of Fallon Worldwide, also part of Publicis.
